content.description: One of Leavenworth's sillier problems, but might as well check it out if you're local. Stand on the little slab to the right of the prow, grab the underside with your right hand and the top with your left, then do some weirdness to get on top. There is a direct sit start with your right hand on the fin and left hand on a slopey edge, but it's hard, V6-7-ish and not worth your time.
content.location: From the "grave" feature, walk up and around (counter-clockwise) to face your starting point to find this problem. You can also see it from the top of the Coffin Watcher problem.

content.description: Sit down in the "grave," grab the lip, and make a slightly confusing but easy mantle. This problem is probably harder for people over 6'. Thrutchy, uninspiring, but I think it has its own sort of charm.
content.protection: 1 pad, but it needs to be less than two feet wide or else it won't fit. A half-pad is perfect.
content.location: At the top of the boulder field there is a small cave in the ground formed by a few tiny boulders. Get in it.
